reviews.review_msg: Taking this class was the worst decision of my undergrad life, SO much memorization its unbelievable, multiple choice questions are always tricky, short answer are okay but if you don't know you are screwed, long answers are hard. For anyone who cares about their mental health I would not recommend taking this class. Weekly homework averages were90

The most straightforward MBB prof I've taken. No textbook, no surprises, everything you need to get an A+ is in the lecture slides. Too much info on each slide, but if you actually attend lectures you'll know what to omit. Ignore the people saying that lectures are dry, because most MBB lectures are dry. The cool stuff in MBB is in research labs.
Might be the easiest 400 level mbb course there is. Exams are straight forward and assignments are super easy. A pure memorization course.
Exams are fair and predictable. No textbook. Everything is either from her assignment questions or the lecture notes. Easy course. Class average was high (80%) but she made that an A-

Super long lectures that are very dry. Very difficult to pay attention in class. Gives far too many details on her slides. No textbook is used so the only source is her lecture notes. Weekly assignments that are long and sometimes difficult. Sometimes require answers not available in the notes. Almost no information can be found online.

MBB 428 with Dr Craig was a very enjoyable course. Her tests are fair and marked as such. Her lecture slides are detailed, but the payoff is that all of the testable material is on the slides, so no textbook is required. She has easy assignments that are basically grade boosters since they are based on the slides. I would highly recommend her!

Had Dr. Craig for both MBB 222 and 428. Very engaging and tries to ensure that her students succeed. Keep in mind that her notes are extremely detailed, though she will often tell you which areas you don't need to know for the exam. I found her to be very approachable in office hours. No walk in the park, but if you put in the work you'll do well.

The material in this class is interesting, but the way she goes through it is patronizing. Her lectures are highly repetitive and the course requires infantile 5 page weekly assignments. The marking scheme often hinged on some trivial detail that was arguably not necessary to answer the question.
Pretty good professor..notes may cover more than what is required for the exam..but she tells you what's important for the exam..very friendly and smart..wouldn't mind taking another class with her..

Dr. Lisa Craig is an awesome professor. She is probably one of the better lecturers in the MBB department. She will tell you what you need to know for exams, but you still need to study. She makes a genuine effort to be clear on materials covered in the course. I highly recommend her.
